columns.text: In this exercise, we are asked to assess the selling rights.

Let us first identify the given amounts in the problem: 


| | Amount$\hspace{5pt}$| 
|:--|--:| 
|Rights offering | $4.7 million|
|Shares outstanding | 530,000| 
|Share price |$55.00|
|Subscription price |$30.00|
|Underwriter Spread| 6%|
|Number of owned shares | 5,000 shares|

The ex-right price is computed as follows: 

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Ex-rights price}&=\dfrac{\text{(RN $\times$ S) + SP}}{\text{1 + RN }}\\
\end{aligned}$$ 

Where: 

RN = Rights needed 

S = Share price 

SP = Subscription price

First, let us determine the required amount of the proceeds per share from sale. This is computed as follows: 

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Net proceeds per share }&={\text{Subscription price $\times$ (1 - Underwriter spread)}}\\
&={\text{\$30.00 $\times$ (1 - 6\%)}}\\
&={\textbf{\$28.20}}
\end{aligned}$$ 

**The net proceeds per share amount to $28.20 per share.**

Next, let us compute the number of rights associated with one of the new shares. This is computed by dividing the shares outstanding by the number of new shares. This is computed as follows: 

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Number of rights }&=\dfrac{\text{Shares outstanding}}{\text{New shares}}\\[10pt]
&=\dfrac{\text{530,000}}{\text{166,667}}\\[10pt]
&={\textbf{3.18}}
\end{aligned}$$ 

**The number of rights required to buy stocks is 3.18 rights.**

Now, we will use the formula from step 3 to compute the ex-rights stock price. This is computed as follows: 



$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Ex-rights price}&=\dfrac{\text{(3.18 $\times$ \$55.00) + \$30.00}}{\text{1 + 3.18}}\\[10pt]
&=\dfrac{\text{\$204.90}}{\text{4.18}}\\[10pt]
&={\textbf{\$49.02}}
\end{aligned}$$ 

**The ex-rights price of the investor amounts to $49.02.**

We can now determine the value of a right by subtracting the share price by the ex-right price per share we have computed from step 7. This is computed as follows: 

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Value of the right}&={\text{Share price - Ex-right price per share}}\\
&={\text{\$55.00 - \$49.02}}\\
&={\textbf{\$5.98}}
\end{aligned}$$ 

**The value of one right amounts to $5.98.**

Then, we need to also determine the number of rights. This is computed as follows: 

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Amount of shares}&={\text{Number of shares  $\times$ Value of one right}}\\
&={\text{5,000 shares $\times$ \$5.98}}\\
&={\textbf{\$29,000.00}}
\end{aligned}$$ 

**The total amount of rights is $29,900.00.**
**To conclude, by selling the rights, the investor can get $29,900.00.**
